messages.message: Update on our resume screening - we know the R1s have not been great recently for frontend :grimacing: We did a pass through some recently rejected candidates' resumes and are still a little stumped about how some of them did poorly considering their resumes. We're going to try something new - there will be anew question candidates have to answer when submitting their resumes asking them to describe a recent React component they built and the technical challenges they faced. This will hopefully screen for both intent and for react knowledge a little better.

This seems like a great idea, but I wonder if some talent might end up not applying if we add this extra step for them. Just speaking from my own experience applying to jobs before joining IB, I personally didn't really bother applying if the initial application felt like it required too much upfront time investment. Especially since candidates are so used to resum√© rejections I feel like it might be too much to expect them to submit a response for that question.
Maybe we can have a character / sentence limit so it's not longer than a paragraph.. although with AI tools it should also be easier for them to come up with a response so idk
But just something we may want to consider
